question: Which of these ratios give the viscosity of a fluid?
option1: ratio of the shearing stress to the velocity gradient
option2: ratio of the shearing stress to the weight of the fluid
option3: ratio of the shearing stress to the density of fluid
option4: ratio of the velocity gradient and shearing stress
answer: ratio of the shearing stress to the velocity gradient
explanation: Viscosity is defined mathematically as the ratio of the shearing stress to the velocity gradient in a fluid. It is represented by the Greek letter Î· (eta).
